intro: Abies obliquata, commonly known as the slant pine, is a species of fir native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, conical shape and dark green, needle-like leaves that are arranged in a distinctive slanted pattern. The plant produces small, cylindrical cones that mature to a reddish-brown color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude forests. The botanical features of Abies obliquata make it an important component of its native ecosystems.

Abies obliquata is well adapted to the harsh climate of these regions, making it a characteristic component of the local flora.
